content.description:
At night, an equilibrium reaction between two different nitrogen compounds generates <math alttext="N 2 O 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> in the atmosphere, as represented below.
Reaction 1: <math alttext="N O 3 gas plus N O 2 gas is in equilibrium with N 2 O 5 gas; K equals 2.6 times 10 to the negative 11 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>⇄</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>) </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mi>K</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>11</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: A mixture of <math alttext="N O 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and a ten-fold excess of <math alttext="N O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> are placed inside a rigid container at constant temperature and allowed to reach equilibrium. Which of the following provides a correct comparison of the equilibrium concentrations of these chemical species, and why?

choices.label: <math alttext="the molar concentration of N 2 O 5 is significantly less than the molar concentration of N O 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext><mo><</mo><mo><</mo><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because a small <math alttext="K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> value indicates that the consumption of the reactants is favored at equilibrium.

<math alttext="the molar concentration of N O 2 is significantly less than molar concentration of N 2 O 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext><mo><</mo><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because a small <math alttext="K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> value indicates that the consumption of the reactants is favored at equilibrium.

<math alttext="the molar concentration of N O 2 is significantly less than the molar concentration of N O 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext><mo><</mo><mo><</mo><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because a small <math alttext="K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> value indicates that the formation of products is not favored at equilibrium.

<math alttext="the molar concentration of N 2 O 5 is significantly less than the molar concentration of N O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext><mo><</mo><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because a small <math alttext="K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> value indicates that the formation of products is not favored at equilibrium.

content.answer: <math alttext="the molar concentration of N 2 O 5 is significantly less than the molar concentration of N O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext><mo><</mo><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because a small <math alttext="K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> value indicates that the formation of products is not favored at equilibrium.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
